rules.natural: In cases where the bartender is licensed, the bar will be orderly.
Whenever the bouncer is checking an identification document, the patron will be intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.
Either the bouncer is checking an identification document or the bouncer is scanning an identification document.
Provided that the bouncer is scanning an identification document, the patron is intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.
Under the condition that the patron is being cut off from service, the bartender will have been serving a drink to the patron.
Either the patron is being cut off from service, or if the bartender mixing a drink does not imply that the drink is not alcoholic, then the bouncer will not perform proper verification.
Either the bouncer is warning the patron or the bouncer is escorting the patron out.
Should the bouncer be escorting the patron out, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.
Given that the patron is committing a first offense, if the bouncer is warning the patron, then the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.
The patron either commits a first offense or commits a repeat offense.
In cases where the patron possesses an identification document, the bartender will be licensed.
Either the patron commits a minor violation, or if the patron is committing a repeat offense, then if the bouncer is warning the patron, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.
The patron either has a valid identification document or has an invalid identification document.
In situations where the patron has an invalid identification document, the patron will possess a counterfeit identification document.
Whenever there is conflicting evidence regarding the patron, the patron will be approved for entry.
Provided that there is conflicting evidence regarding the patron, the patron will not be approved for entry.
Should the manager make a decision, the patron will not be allowed entry.
Either the manager makes a decision, or if the bartender is not licensed, then the staff member will not be unlicensed.
In instances where the patron possesses a counterfeit identification document, the bartender will be licensed.
Provided that the patron is denied entry, the patron will be allowed entry.
Whenever the manager violates policy, if the manager making a decision does not imply that the patron is denied entry, then the patron will be pending review.
Under the condition that the bartender uses a shaker tool, the bartender will be mixing a drink.
Either the bartender uses a shaker tool, or the patron is not under the legal drinking age.
In cases where the bartender is mixing a drink, the drink will be alcoholic.
Provided that the bartender is mixing a drink, the drink will be non-alcoholic.
In situations where the drink is non-alcoholic, the drink will not be alcoholic.
Under the condition that the patron is playing the game of darts, the patron will be sober.
Either the patron is playing the game of darts, or the patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document.

In circumstances where it is not the case that the patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document, the patron will be under the legal drinking age.
In cases where it is not the case that if the bartender is mixing a drink then the drink is not alcoholic, the bouncer will perform proper verification.

In instances where it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the patron has a valid identification document then the patron possesses an identification document, then the patron has a questionable identification document, then the patron has an unclear identification document, there will be conflicting evidence regarding the patron.
Provided that the bartender is not licensed, the staff member will be unlicensed.

The patron does not have a questionable identification document.
It is not the case that the patron has an unclear identification document.
The patron is not pending review.

(A1 → G).natural: In cases where the bartender is licensed, the bar will be orderly.

(A11 ∨ ¬A10).natural: Either the patron is intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.

(A12 → (A11 ∨ ¬A10)).natural: Whenever the bouncer is checking an identification document, the patron will be intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either the bouncer is checking an identification document or the bouncer is scanning an identification document.

(A13 → (A11 ∨ ¬A10)).natural: Provided that the bouncer is scanning an identification document, the patron is intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.

(A15 → A16).natural: Under the condition that the patron is being cut off from service, the bartender will have been serving a drink to the patron.

(A15 ∨ (¬(A6 → ¬A7) → ¬A14)).natural: Either the patron is being cut off from service, or if the bartender mixing a drink does not imply that the drink is not alcoholic, then the bouncer will not perform proper verification.

(A17 → ¬A16).natural: In instances where the bouncer is warning the patron, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either the bouncer is warning the patron or the bouncer is escorting the patron out.

(A18 → ¬A16).natural: Should the bouncer be escorting the patron out, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.

(A19 → (A17 → ¬A16)).natural: Given that the patron is committing a first offense, if the bouncer is warning the patron, then the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: The patron either commits a first offense or commits a repeat offense.

(A2 → A1).natural: In cases where the patron possesses an identification document, the bartender will be licensed.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: The patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document.

(A20 → (A17 → ¬A16)).natural: Provided that the patron is committing a repeat offense, if the bouncer is warning the patron, then the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.

(A21 ∨ (A20 → (A17 → ¬A16))).natural: Either the patron commits a minor violation, or if the patron is committing a repeat offense, then if the bouncer is warning the patron, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.

(A22 → A2).natural: Under the condition that the patron has a valid identification document, the patron will possess an identification document.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: The patron either has a valid identification document or has an invalid identification document.

(A23 → A3).natural: In situations where the patron has an invalid identification document, the patron will possess a counterfeit identification document.

(A26 → A27).natural: Whenever there is conflicting evidence regarding the patron, the patron will be approved for entry.

(A26 → ¬A27).natural: Provided that there is conflicting evidence regarding the patron, the patron will not be approved for entry.

(A29 → A30).natural: In cases where the manager makes a decision, the patron will be allowed entry.

(A29 → A31).natural: Under the condition that the manager makes a decision, the patron will be denied entry.

(A29 → ¬A30).natural: Should the manager make a decision, the patron will not be allowed entry.

(A29 ∨ (¬A1 → ¬A28)).natural: Either the manager makes a decision, or if the bartender is not licensed, then the staff member will not be unlicensed.

(A3 → A1).natural: In instances where the patron possesses a counterfeit identification document, the bartender will be licensed.

(A31 → A30).natural: Provided that the patron is denied entry, the patron will be allowed entry.

(A33 → (¬(A29 → A31) → A32)).natural: Whenever the manager violates policy, if the manager making a decision does not imply that the patron is denied entry, then the patron will be pending review.

(A5 → A6).natural: Under the condition that the bartender uses a shaker tool, the bartender will be mixing a drink.

(A5 ∨ ¬A4).natural: Either the bartender uses a shaker tool, or the patron is not under the legal drinking age.

(A6 → A7).natural: In cases where the bartender is mixing a drink, the drink will be alcoholic.

(A6 → A8).natural: Provided that the bartender is mixing a drink, the drink will be non-alcoholic.

(A6 → ¬A7).natural: Should the bartender be mixing a drink, the drink will not be alcoholic.

(A8 → ¬A7).natural: In situations where the drink is non-alcoholic, the drink will not be alcoholic.

(A9 → A10).natural: Under the condition that the patron is playing the game of darts, the patron will be sober.

(A9 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Either the patron is playing the game of darts, or the patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document.

(¬(A2 ∨ A3) → A4).natural: In circumstances where it is not the case that the patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document, the patron will be under the legal drinking age.

(¬(A22 → A2) → A24).natural: Whenever it is not the case that if the patron has a valid identification document then the patron possesses an identification document, the patron will have a questionable identification document.

(¬(A29 → A31) → A32).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if the manager makes a decision then the patron is denied entry, the patron will be pending review.

(¬(A6 → ¬A7) → A14).natural: In cases where it is not the case that if the bartender is mixing a drink then the drink is not alcoholic, the bouncer will perform proper verification.

(¬(A6 → ¬A7) → ¬A14).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the bartender is mixing a drink then the drink is not alcoholic, the bouncer will not perform proper verification.

(¬(¬(A22 → A2) → A24) → A25).natural: Whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the patron has a valid identification document then the patron possesses an identification document, then the patron has a questionable identification document, the patron will have an unclear identification document.

(¬(¬(¬(A22 → A2) → A24) → A25) → A26).natural: In instances where it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the patron has a valid identification document then the patron possesses an identification document, then the patron has a questionable identification document, then the patron has an unclear identification document, there will be conflicting evidence regarding the patron.

(¬A1 → A28).natural: Provided that the bartender is not licensed, the staff member will be unlicensed.

(¬A1 → ¬A28).natural: Under the condition that the bartender is not licensed, the staff member will not be unlicensed.
